text: The Pale-flowered Lily, Turanian fritillary or the Uyghür Aigul (Fritillaria pallidiflora) is an Asian species of bulbous flowering plant in the lily family Liliaceae, native to East Turkestan, Kyrgyzstan and Kazakhstan.伊贝母 yi bei mu Fritillaria pallidiflora Flora of China. The Latin specific epithet pallidiflora means “pale flowered”. Although the common name frequently used is Siberian fritillary, a misnomer because the species does not grow in the wild in Siberia. ==References== Category:Plants of Asia Category:Liliaceae
title: Fritillaria pallidiflora
